skill.name: internal-comms
skill.description: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my company likes to use. Claude should use this skill whenever asked to write some sort of internal communications (status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, project updates, etc.).
skill.summary: A set of resources to help me write all kinds of internal communications, using the formats that my ...
skill.author: Community

security_audit.summary: This official skill contains only writing guidance and examples. No executable code or external calls are present, so risk is minimal.

content.value_statement: Teams struggle to keep internal updates consistent and concise. This skill provides proven formats and guidance for common company communications.
actual_capabilities: Format 3P updates with Progress, Plans, and Problems sections
Draft company newsletters with sections and short bullets
Write FAQ items using Question and Answer format
Gather audience, purpose, tone, and format for general comms
limitations: Needs user provided facts, metrics, and links
Does not provide a dedicated incident report template beyond general guidance
Cannot access Slack, email, or documents without user input
Covers only the formats included in the examples

use_cases.title: Weekly 3P update
use_cases.description: Create a concise Progress, Plans, Problems update for leadership review in under one minute.

use_cases.title: Company newsletter
use_cases.description: Compile a weekly newsletter with sections, links, and highlights for all employees.

use_cases.title: FAQ roundup
use_cases.description: Summarize top employee questions and provide official, clear answers.

prompt_templates.title: Basic 3P update
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs a weekly team update
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a 3P update for the Mobile team covering last week. Progress: shipped login fix. Plans: release new onboarding. Problems: QA bandwidth.

prompt_templates.title: Newsletter draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a company newsletter for last week. Include sections for announcements, progress, leadership updates, and social updates. Use short bullets.

prompt_templates.title: FAQ summary
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants a weekly FAQ list
prompt_templates.prompt: Create five FAQ items from these topics: new executive hire, hiring plan, product launch date, office policy change, and fundraising update.

prompt_templates.title: General comms brief
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs a custom internal message
prompt_templates.prompt: Ask me the key questions you need, then draft a concise internal message about a new remote work policy.

output_examples.input: Write a 3P update for the Data team for last week.
output: Progress: Shipped the metrics dashboard refresh and reduced query latency by 18 percent.
Plans: Roll out anomaly alerts and finalize the data catalog migration plan.
Problems: Two open analyst roles are slowing onboarding of new datasets.

best_practices: Confirm the communication type and audience before drafting
Use short sentences and include links when provided
State uncertainty and reference official sources
anti_patterns: Mixing newsletter and 3P formats in one message
Including small team details in company wide updates
Writing without confirming scope or time period

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides text guidance and templates that work in any of those tools.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It only covers the formats in the examples and relies on your input for content.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Slack or email data?
faq.answer: Only if you provide access or paste the relevant content for drafting.

faq.question: Does it store or transmit company data?
faq.answer: No, it is a local guidance skill and does not include data handling code.

faq.question: What should I do if the output feels too generic?
faq.answer: Provide specific facts, metrics, and links, plus the exact audience and tone.

faq.question: How does it compare to a general writing assistant?
faq.answer: It enforces company style formats like 3P updates, newsletters, and FAQs.
